definition: to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first

sentences.english: Summer and winter and springtime and harvest.
sentences.chinese: 春夏秋冬四季，有栽種有收成。

sentences.english: Trees were cut down, but none were planted.
sentences.chinese: 樹木被濫砍濫伐，新樹卻無人栽種。

sentences.english: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.
sentences.chinese: 我是真的葡萄樹，我父上帝是栽種的人。

sentences.english: The researchers said there are close ties between duck grazing patterns and rice cropping intensity.
sentences.chinese: 研究員指出，放養鴨子和水稻栽種密度也有密切關聯。

sentences.english: The beautiful garden was edged with flowering trees.
sentences.chinese: 那個美麗的花園的邊沿栽種着樹木，樹上繁花盛開。

sentences.english: Organic vegetables taste more delicious than those treated with chemical fertilizers.
sentences.chinese: 有機蔬菜嚐起來比化學肥料栽種的要好喫。

sentences.english: We have grown a lot of beautiful roses this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年我們栽種了許多漂亮的玫瑰。

sentences.english: Many thousands of trees must be planted every year.
sentences.chinese: 71每年必須栽種成千上萬株樹。

sentences.english: The new resistanttrees will be planted in bristlecone habitat.
sentences.chinese: 新培育的具抵抗力的樹苗就栽種到針毬松生長區。

sentences.english: Plant thou no rose at my head.
And now she is planted in the wilderness, in a dry and thirsty ground.
sentences.chinese: 現在它被栽種在曠野，在乾旱無水之地。

sentences.english: Twice a year, large teams of women plant thousands of trees.
sentences.chinese: 每年有兩次，大批大批的婦女栽種成千上萬株樹。

sentences.english: for produce and for locally grown organic products.
sentences.chinese: 他們會購買農產品和本地栽種的有機產品。

sentences.english: The foresters spaced the seedlings out in rows.
sentences.chinese: 林務員把樹苗一行行等距栽種。

sentences.english: but it's pretty much locally grown product.
sentences.chinese: 但都是本地栽種的產品。

sentences.english: Hami melon from Shanshan County of Xinjiang has a history of more than 700 years.
sentences.chinese: 鄯善地區栽種哈密瓜已有700餘年的歷史。

definition: to clear a wild area for cultivation/to put under the plow
site developed for a group of related enterprises/(industrial or technology) park
to sponsor/to adopt (pledge to give sb or sth one's special attention or support)/to adopt (choose to raise a child or animal as one's own)
